page.title: 08S.E.LUTON URBAN TRANSECT(2)
page.content: {2.INNER ZONE. }A mixed area of slate roofed, brick built terraces, corner shops, pubs, churches, schools, small industrial units and patches of redevelopment including two storey maisonettes and large blocks of flats.There is little open space. The terraced houses were built in the early years of this century for workers in the new engineering works. In l985 they sell for around Â£2O,OOO. {3.OUTER ZONE.}For the most part semi_ detached, brick built suburban housing _ front and rear gardens but no garages when they were built in the post_war years. Current cost around Â£35,000. Also, on the fringe of town some individually designed detached houses costing Â£70_l00,000. {4.OPEN COUNTRYSIDE.}The Luton Hoo estate _ mixture of arable land, woodland and ornamental parkland.
